metadata.title: 5443-2 -- Linux kernel vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Kyle Zeng discovered that the Network Queuing and Scheduling subsystem of the Linux kernel did not properly perform reference counting in some situations, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2022-29581)  Jann Horn discovered that the Linux kernel did not properly enforce seccomp restrictions in some situations. A local attacker could use this to bypass intended seccomp sandbox restrictions. (CVE-2022-30594)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo ua fix USN-5443-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-tools-oracle - 5.13.0.1030.30 linux-headers-oracle - 5.13.0.1030.30 linux-image-oracle - 5.13.0.1030.30 linux-oracle - 5.13.0.1030.30 No subscription required  linux-modules-extra-5.13.0-1030-oracle - 5.13.0-1030.35 linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1030-oracle - 5.13.0-1030.35 linux-oracle-tools-5.13.0-1030 - 5.13.0-1030.35 linux-oracle-headers-5.13.0-1030 - 5.13.0-1030.35 linux-modules-5.13.0-1030-oracle - 5.13.0-1030.35 linux-image-5.13.0-1030-oracle - 5.13.0-1030.35 linux-buildinfo-5.13.0-1030-oracle - 5.13.0-1030.35 linux-headers-5.13.0-1030-oracle - 5.13.0-1030.35 linux-tools-5.13.0-1030-oracle - 5.13.0-1030.35 No subscription required
